newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey imports power from Bulgaria, Georgia, Iran.
newsitem.headline: Turkey imports power from Bulgaria, Georgia, Iran.

text.p: Turkey began importing power from neighbouring Bulgaria, Georgia and Iran to make up the shortfall this year, Energy Minister Recai Kutan said on Thursday.
"With the imports of 2.5 billion kilowatt hours (kWh), there will not be any shortage in 1997," Kutan told a conference.
He said Turkey's 1997 electricity demand was estimated at 106 billion kWh against its projected output of 104 billion.
Electric power production stood at 95.4 billion kWh last year when Turkey imported power from Bulgaria and Iran to meet its total consumption of 97.5 billion kWh.
